inclusion.criterion: coronary stenoses between 40-70% severity and severe aortic stenosis undergoing TAVR work-up
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: The patient underwent cardiac cath with right heart cath to evaluate his pulm art pressures which showed no angiographically apparent flow-limiting coronary artery disease, but also had carotid US showing moderate heterogeneous plaque with bilateral 1-39% ICA stenosis.

inclusion.criterion: severe aortic stenosis undergoing TAVR work-up
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: TTE revealed severe aortic stenosis with worsening LV function. Repeat echo confirmed critical aortic stenosis showing left ventricular hypertrophy with cavity dilation and severe global hypokinesis, severe aortic valve stenosis with underlying bicuspid aortic valve.

exclusion.label: does_not_trigger
exclusion.evidence: The patient was sent home from cardiology clinic with Lasix and BB (which he did not tolerate), continued to have worsening SOB and LE edema, but there is no mention of cardiogenic shock.

exclusion.label: does_not_trigger
exclusion.evidence: The patient underwent cardiac cath with right heart cath to evaluate his pulm art pressures which showed no angiographically apparent flow-limiting coronary artery disease, indicating no acute coronary syndrome.

notes: The patient's carotid US shows moderate heterogeneous plaque with bilateral 1-39% ICA stenosis, but it is unclear if this meets the trial's inclusion criteria for coronary stenoses between 40-70% severity. Additionally, there is no mention of contraindication to adenosine.
